scenario_1.justification: Bodily injury reserve calculated using moderate injury multiplier (3x) on total medical ($5,800 ER + PT + possible injections) plus lost wages ($3,200), with attorney factor (1.5x) and average jurisdiction factor (1.0x). Property damage includes repair estimate ($8,750) plus rental ($450) with 10% contingency. Medical expense reserve set at current ER bill pending further treatment documentation. Policy sections 2.1-2.3 guide these calculations.

scenario_2.justification: Reserves significantly increased due to surgical recommendation and extended disability. Indemnity includes 12 weeks TTD ($7,600) plus 15% contingency. Medical includes surgery ($25,000) plus PT ($4,500) with 20% contingency. Rehabilitation reserve set at 2 months vocational services ($9,000) based on potential permanent restrictions. Policy sections 3.1-3.4 support these adjustments triggered by new medical information.

scenario_3.justification: Separate reserves set for each exposure type per section 4.3. Property damage includes all store damages ($110,700) plus common area ($12,000) with 15% contingency. Business interruption includes documented losses ($31,000) plus 10% contingency. Emergency response at claimed amount pending verification. Policy sections 4.1-4.4 guide these calculations, considering potential subrogation and contractual obligations.
